Course.Name: Digital Image Processing
Course.Description: The course presents fundamental concepts and applications of digital image processing. Topics include basic color, image perception and transformation, image enhancement and compression, and image analysis, and computer vision.
Course.Prerequisite: Undergraduate level CSCI 3333 or CMPE 3333 Minimum Grade of D

Cross-listed.item: A student may receive credit in only one course.

Restrictions.item: May not be enrolled in one of the following Programs:
May not be enrolled in one of the following Levels:

Course.Course-attributes: Degree Elective, CS Instruction Fee - HU
